column1: '''Cor Blok''' ([[1934]]-) is a retired Dutch professor of art history. In the 1960s
column2: he created more than one hundred pieces of art influenced by the legendarium of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].

column1: J.R.R. Tolkien himself was fond of Blok's minimalistic illustrations
column2: and bought two ("The Battle of Hornburg" and "The Dead Marshes") and was given another ("Dunhov").

column1: Blok's illustrations have been featured as cover art for a Dutch edition of ''The Lord of the Rings'' (Spectrum paperback edition in three volumes

column2: there was a Cor Blok exhibition at the Lustrum celebrations of [[Unquendor]] (the Dutch Tolkien Society)
column3: where Blok was guest of honor.

column1: Cor Blok's paper "Pictures to accompany a Great Story" was published in ''[[Lembas Extra: Proceedings of the 5th Unquendor Lustrum]]'' in [[2008]].

column2: [[HarperCollins]] published a collection of Blok's pictures inspired by ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''
column3: entitled ''[[A Tolkien Tapestry]]'' (edited by [[Pieter Collier]]).<ref>[http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/press/991-A_Tolkien_Tapestry.php A Tolkien Tapestry] at [http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/index.php TolkienLibrary.com] (accessed 29 September 2011)</ref>

column1: *[http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/press/937-Interview_Cor_Blok_Tolkien_Calendar_2011.php Interview with Cor Blok on Tolkien Library]
